intro: Flourensia leptopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flourensia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers appear in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
